msbt.message: I was SUCH a troublemaker back in the day

When I worked in an antique store, I bumped into this really old vase. Smashed it to bits!I thought nobody'd notice if I made another vase outta clay and stuck it on the shelf. Ha! Wrong!So this rich guy comes in. He sees my awful vase, says it's a "work of art," and pays a fortune for it!I could NOT stop laughing until my boss found out what happened, .So much for that job!

I used to be friends with this girl. She wanted to be a singer, so she started singing near shops in town.She told me nobody ever stopped to listen to her, so I went out to show some support.She was AWFUL! Totally tone-deaf. I couldn't stand it, so I snatched her mic and started singing myself.I got super into it, and started showing off my rock star scream. Like YEEEEEAAAAAH!Bwa ha ha! Everyone HATED it. I was way worse than my friend!

I remember this one time I went to the store. I was in a big rush, so I didn't grab a cart.Before I knew it, I was carrying ice cream, pickles, pizza, coffee, eggs, pancakes, chocolateeverything!I was on my way to check out when I kinda slipped. I tried to hang on to my food-tower, but WellCleanup on aisle four, !
I am the WORST at doing housework.

I tried to do laundry last week. I dumped in way too much detergent, then I ALSO forgot to close the lid.By the time I noticed, it looked like an avalanche came through!Honestly, I couldn't stop giggling even if it DID take a whole day to clean, .

Like, I got this sudden urge to cook a while back, but my food came out waaaay too sweet.I followed the recipeexcept for the part where I grabbed sugar instead of salt. Oops!Yeah, it tasted bad, .It got me thinking though. If you're gonna mess up cooking, go big! That's how new foods get made!

A few days ago I was getting stuff ready to scrub my floors.But I tripped and punted the bucket! Soap went everywhere, then the bucket bounced back into my face!It was such a mess, . Plus my nose REALLY hurt!
Ever since I was a kid, I've had this bad habit of buying weird stuff I don't really want.

Like I was at this fair once, and I saw this huge model of an amoeba.I totally couldn't help myself! For some reason, I just had to have it. I'm not even that into biology.Now it's just gathering dust in my parents' attic. It's probably gonna be there forever, !

There was this paper lantern I saw in a souvenir shop. It had my name on it, so I had to have it.It was super ugly, ! I threw it in a closet as soon I got home.It actually did come in handy when I lost power last summer though.

I saw a really good sale on some moai-shaped cushions. They looked so big and soft and cool!I bought a few of 'em, but when I actually sat on one, they were just kinda lumpy and uncomfortable.I guess that's why they were on sale,
Do you have any favorite sayings? I've got tons!

Like, "When you wanna cry is when you gotta laugh." My granny said that a lot, .It's easier than it sounds, and laughing your way through tears really helps sometimes.Remember that next time you're feeling down, OK?

Like, "You can do anything if you try." I like to psych myself up with that one, .Way back when, I used to give up the minute things got tough. I just got so angry!I started saying that to myself whenever I felt like quitting. It really helped me push myself!

"Failure is the mother of success." That's a really famous saying!I used to freak out whenever I made a mistake, but that saying helped me turn things around.Now I'm always trying to learn from my mistakes so I can do better the next time, !

I loved listening to my grandparents tell stories. Things were SO different when they were kids!Their games were different, their clothes were different, even getting to the next town was different!It was so cool to hear about. It all sounded so weird, !

My grandpa had a bad leg, so when I was little, I'd give him rides in my wagon. I thought I was helping him!A neighbor saw us once and told us to stop. Grandpa just winked and thanked me for the ride.Y'know, as much as I thought I was helping him, it was really the other way around, .

There was this old lady who hung out on a park bench when I was a kid. She kinda scared me.One day I finally said hi and she started talking. And talking. And talking. And then it was dark!Anyway, long story short, if you ever have questions about dentures, I'm your gal, .
The neighbor kid back home really looks up to me. I kinda wonder how he's been holding up.

When I was packing up to move out, I gave him an old, beat-up copy of .I guess he liked it, 'cause he sent a letter saying he'd read it something like times!Honestly, I could never make it past the first chapter, .

He bragged once about how brave he was and how nothing could scare him. No way I was gonna let that go!It wasn't even an hour later. I snuck up right behind him, and I went<10_4 /> <10_10 />WAAAAAAAAAAAAH!<10_9 />He. Didn't. Even. Flinch. He just calmly turned around, smiled, and walked off, .That kid's got nerves of steel!

He loved my cooking. It never mattered what I made, he always wanted some of it, .One time I completely burned my lunch in the oven. I was about to throw it out, but he stopped me.And off he went with a bottle of hot sauce in one hand and a burned lump of lunch in the other. Yikes!
I found a bunch of old photos when I was cleaning the other day.

There's this one shot of me when I was in school, .We had school uniforms with real long skirts. I remember I tripped over mine, like, twenty times a day.Yeah, I definitely wasn't the most graceful when I was little.

There's a whole stack of 'em from when I was in school, .I thought I was so cool 'cause I only used one strap on my backpack. But every kid in every school does that!Plus, school books can get really stinkin' heavy! Ugh No wonder my shoulder's still got problems.

I was looking through the ones from back when I was in school, and wow! I've changed SO much, !School was such a wild and weird time for me. I tried everything, from preppy to punk to sports to drama.Figuring out who you are is hard. But you gotta do it 'cause, like, who else is gonna? You owe it to yourself!
